summary: The International Financial Institution Improvements Act of 2025 aims to enhance the operations, accountability, and transparency of international financial institutions (IFIs) like the World Bank and IMF. It focuses on debt forgiveness for low-income countries, promoting human rights and environmental standards in projects, increasing collaboration with civil society, and combating corruption. Provisions include directing the Secretary of the Treasury to advocate for various reforms within IFIs related to transparency, project evaluation, anti-corruption measures, climate change, and human rights. The bill also addresses capital increases for multilateral development banks and U.S. contributions to these institutions.
